instruction: Implement a cubic core-shell structure modeling with LAMMPS.
input: The core is composed of Cu atoms, with an outer layer coated with a certain thickness of Cu atoms. Create two regions for the core and the outer shell, and use the create_atoms command to fill atoms in both regions.
output:
# Model basic parameters
units metal  # Units: real units
boundary p p p  # Boundary conditions, periodic boundaries
atom_style atomic  # Atom type

# Create a square region
region box block 0 100 0 100 0 100  # Create a square region
create_box 2 box  # Generate a square box, 2 types of atoms

# Create a spherical shell region
region block1 block 0 100 0 100 0 100 units box
region block2 block 20 80 20 80 20 80 side out units box
region shell intersect 2 block1 block2  # A shell with a thickness of 20

# Create a core region
region block_in block 20 80 20 80 20 80 units box

# Fill the core with type 2 atoms
lattice fcc 3.61  # Lattice constant 3.61
create_atoms 2 region block_in
# Fill the shell with type 1 atoms
lattice fcc 3.61  # Lattice constant 3.61
create_atoms 1 region shell

# Set atomic masses
mass 2 63.5  # Mass of type 2 atoms
mass 1 63.5  # Mass of type 1 atoms

# Save file
write_data heke.data

instruction: Implement a spherical shell structure modeling with LAMMPS.
input:
The core is made of Al atoms, with an outer layer coated with a certain thickness of Al atoms. Method:
(1) Create two spherical regions for the inner and outer spheres.
(2) Fill the outer sphere region with type 1 atoms.
(3) Remove type 1 atoms filled in the inner sphere region.
(4) Fill the inner sphere region with type 2 atoms.
output:
# Model basic parameters
units metal
atom_style atomic
boundary p p p
# Create simulation region
region box block -50 50 -50 50 -50 50 # Generate a rectangular box region with a side length of 100
create_box 2 box
# Create outer sphere region
region ball1 sphere 0 0 0 50 units box  # Generate a spherical region with a radius of 50

# Create inner sphere region
region ball2 sphere 0 0 0 40 units box # Generate a spherical region with a radius of 40, creating a shell thickness of 10

# Fill the outer sphere region with type 1 atoms
lattice fcc 4.05  # Set lattice parameter
create_atoms 1 region ball1

# Delete type 1 atoms in the inner sphere region
delete_atoms region ball2 compress yes  # Compress IDs

# Fill the inner sphere region with type 2 atoms
lattice fcc 4.05 # Set lattice parameter
create_atoms 2 region ball2

# Set atomic masses
mass 1 27 # Set mass of type 1 atoms to 27
mass 2 27 # Set mass of type 2 atoms to 27

# Save file
write_data qiuke.data # Output qiuke.data file

instruction: Implement a capsule particle molecular model with LAMMPS.
input: Taking Cu atoms as an example. Create three regions: the upper hemisphere region, the cylindrical region, and the lower hemisphere region.
output:
# Model basic parameters
units metal # Atom model: Metal unit model
boundary p p p # Boundary conditions, periodic boundaries
atom_style atomic # Atom type

# Generate a rectangular region
region box block -40 40 -40 40 -80 80  # Create a rectangular region
create_box 1 box # Generate a box, 2 types of atoms

# Create a cylindrical region
region cylinder1_out cylinder z 0 0 40 -40 40 side out units box   # Cylindrical outer side
region cylinder2_out cylinder z 0 0 40 -40 40 units box            # Cylindrical inner side

# Create hemispherical regions
region ball1_out sphere 0 0 40 40 units box
region ball2_out sphere 0 0 -40 40 units box
region banqiu1_out intersect 2 ball1_out cylinder1_out # Upper hemisphere
region banqiu2_out intersect 2 ball2_out cylinder1_out # Lower hemisphere

# Fill the outer layer with type 1 atoms
lattice fcc 3.62 # Lattice parameter setting
create_atoms 1 region banqiu1_out # Fill the upper hemisphere with type 1 atoms
create_atoms 1 region banqiu2_out # Fill the lower hemisphere with type 1 atoms
create_atoms 1 region cylinder2_out # Fill the cylinder with type 1 atoms

# Set atomic mass
mass 1 64 # Mass of type 1 atoms

# Save file
write_data jiaonang.data

instruction: Implement a nanotube model with LAMMPS.
input: Create three regions: the inner cylindrical region, the outer cylindrical region, and the tube region.
output:
# Model basic parameters
units metal # Atom model: Metal unit model
boundary p p p # Boundary conditions, periodic boundaries
atom_style atomic # Atom type

# Generate a rectangular region
region box block -40 40 -40 40 -80 80  # Create a rectangular region
create_box 1 box # Generate a box with 2 types of atoms

# Create a cylindrical region
region cylinder1 cylinder z 0 0 30 -80 80 side out units box   # Outer cylinder
region cylinder2 cylinder z 0 0 40 -80 80 units box            # Inner cylinder

# Create a tube layer region
region tube intersect 2 cylinder1 cylinder2 # Tube region

# Fill the outer layer with type 1 atoms
lattice hcp 5 # Lattice parameter setting
create_atoms 1 region tube # Fill the tube region with type 1 atoms

# Set atomic mass
mass 1 64 # Mass of type 1 atoms

# Save file
write_data tube.data

instruction: Implement a high-entropy alloy modeling with LAMMPS.
output:
# Initial simulation system setup
units metal # Units
boundary p p p # Boundary conditions
atom_style atomic # Atom type
timestep 0.001 # Time step

# Build the model
lattice fcc 3.56 # Set lattice parameters
region box block 0 10 0 10 0 10 # Create a rectangular region
create_box 5 box
create_atoms 1 box

# Convert atoms of type 1 to other types
set type 1 type/ratio 2 0.2 87393 # Convert 20% of type 1 atoms to type 2 atoms
set type 1 type/ratio 3 0.5 87393 # Convert 50% of type 1 atoms to type 3 atoms
set type 1 type/ratio 4 0.5 87393 # Convert 50% of type 1 atoms to type 4 atoms
set type 3 type/ratio 5 0.5 87393 # Convert 50% of type 3 atoms to type 5 atoms

# Set atomic types
mass 1 27 # Al atom
mass 2 56 # Fe atom
mass 3 28 # Si atom
mass 4 64 # Cu atom
mass 5 24 # Mg atom

write_data AlCuFeMgSi.data # Output data file

instruction: Implement a capsule core-shell structure modeling with LAMMPS.
input: It is necessary to create the following regions twice: the upper hemisphere region, the cylindrical region, and the lower hemisphere region.
output:
# Model basic parameters
units metal # Atom model: Metal unit model
boundary p p p # Boundary conditions, periodic boundaries
atom_style atomic # Atom type

# Generate a rectangular region
region box block -40 40 -40 40 -80 80 # Create a rectangular region
create_box 2 box # Generate a box with 2 types of atoms

# Create outer cylindrical region
region cylinder1_out cylinder z 0 0 40 -40 40 side out units box # Outer side of the outer cylinder
region cylinder2_out cylinder z 0 0 40 -40 40 units box # Inner side of the outer cylinder

# Create inner cylindrical region
region cylinder1_in cylinder z 0 0 30 -30 30 side out units box # Outer side of the inner cylinder
region cylinder2_in cylinder z 0 0 30 -30 30 units box # Inner side of the inner cylinder

# Create outer hemispherical regions
region ball1_out sphere 0 0 40 40 units box
region ball2_out sphere 0 0 -40 40 units box
region banqiu1_out intersect 2 ball1_out cylinder1_out # Outer upper hemisphere
region banqiu2_out intersect 2 ball2_out cylinder1_out # Outer lower hemisphere

# Create inner hemispherical regions
region ball1_in sphere 0 0 40 30 units box
region ball2_in sphere 0 0 -40 30 units box
region banqiu1_in intersect 2 ball1_in cylinder1_in # Inner upper hemisphere
region banqiu2_in intersect 2 ball2_in cylinder1_in # Inner lower hemisphere

# Fill the outer layer with type 1 atoms
lattice fcc 3.5288 # Lattice constant for Bi: 3.5288
create_atoms 1 region banqiu1_out # Fill the outer upper hemisphere with type 1 atoms
create_atoms 1 region banqiu2_out # Fill the outer lower hemisphere with type 1 atoms
create_atoms 1 region cylinder2_out # Fill the outer cylinder with type 1 atoms

# Delete type 1 atoms in the inner core region
delete_atoms region banqiu1_in compress yes # Delete type 1 atoms in the inner upper hemisphere
delete_atoms region banqiu2_in compress yes # Delete type 1 atoms in the inner lower hemisphere
delete_atoms region cylinder2_in compress yes # Delete type 1 atoms in the inner cylinder

# Fill the inner core with type 2 atoms
lattice sc 3.27 # Lattice constant for type 2 atoms: 3.27
create_atoms 2 region banqiu1_in # Fill the inner upper hemisphere with type 2 atoms
create_atoms 2 region banqiu2_in # Fill the inner lower hemisphere with type 2 atoms
create_atoms 2 region cylinder2_in # Fill the inner cylinder with type 2 atoms

# Set atomic masses
mass 1 60 # Mass of type 1 atoms: 60 (arbitrary value set here)
mass 2 200 # Mass of type 2 atoms: 200 (arbitrary value set here)

# Save file
write_data jiaonang.data

instruction: Implement modeling of high-entropy alloy AlCuFeMgSi using LAMMPS.
input:
The main process is as follows:
(1)Determine the general lattice structure, whether it is fcc or bcc, which can be obtained by consulting literature.
(2)Determine the lattice constant, which can be the largest lattice constant among the alloy elements, but it is not necessary to choose the largest lattice constant; other numbers can also be selected. The lattice constant is only used for initial modeling, and an accurate lattice constant value will be obtained after relaxation.
(3)Generate a box and fill it with type 1 atoms.
(4)Use the set type/ratio command to randomly select atoms in proportion and convert them into other types of atoms.
output:
# Initial simulation system setup
units metal
boundary p p p
atom_style atomic
timestep 0.001
# Build the model
lattice fcc 3.56
region box block 0 10 0 10 0 10 
create_box 5 box
create_atoms 1 box
# Convert atoms of type 1 to other types
set type 1 type/ratio 2 0.2 87393
set type 1 type/ratio 3 0.5 87393
set type 1 type/ratio 4 0.5 87393
set type 3 type/ratio 5 0.5 87393
# Set atomic types
mass 1 27 # Al
mass 2 56 # Fe
mass 3 28 # Si
mass 4 64 # Cu
mass 5 24 # Mg
write_data AlCuFeMgSi.data

instruction: Implement modeling of a composite of cylindrical Ni and graphene layers using LAMMPS, inserting a layer of graphene into the cylindrical Ni nanorod.
output:
# Basic parameter settings in the input file
units metal
boundary p p p
atom_style atomic

# Generate a cylindrical Ni nanorod along the Z axis, with the cylinder rotation axis coordinates (0,0)
# The radius is 30, and the top and bottom bases of the cylinder are at z-axis coordinates (-60,60), meaning the cylinder height is 120
region ni cylinder z 0 0 30 -60 60 units box
# Generate the simulation box based on region ni, note: the simulation box is a cuboid, not a cylinder
create_box 2 ni
# Set the Ni lattice parameter and fill Ni atoms within region ni
lattice fcc 3.52
create_atoms 1 region ni

# Delete the middle Ni layer
region Ni_del block INF INF INF INF 0 3 units box
delete_atoms region Ni_del

# Generate a Graphene layer
lattice custom 2.4768 a1 1.0 0.0 0.0 a2 0.0 1.732 0.0 a3 0.0 0.0 1.3727 &
basis 0.0 0.33333 0.0 &
basis 0.0 0.66667 0.0 &
basis 0.5 0.16667 0.0 &
basis 0.5 0.83333 0.0

# Create a region to fill graphene atoms
region Gp cylinder z 0 0 30 0 3 units box
create_atoms 2 region Gp

# Set atomic masses
mass 1 58.7
mass 2 12.0

write_data ni.xyz

instruction: Implement modeling of NiTi alloy using LAMMPS.
input:
Modeling process:
(1)Use the lattice custom command to generate a square box, set the basis parameter to determine the atomic positions. The corner atom coordinates are (0,0,0), and the center atom coordinates are (0.5, 0.5, 0.5).
(2)Use create_atoms and basis to specify the corner atom type as 2 and the center atom type as 1.
(3)Determine that 1 is a Ni atom and 2 is a Ti atom through mass.
output:
# NiTi modeling
lattice custom 3.01 a1 1 0 0 a2 0 1 0 a3 0 0 1 &
            basis 0 0 0 &
            basis 0.5 0.5 0.5
region box block 0.0 10.0 0.0 10.0 0.0 10.0
create_box 2 box
create_atoms 1 box basis 1 2 basis 2 1
mass 1 58.693 # Ni
mass 2 47.867 # Ti
write_data NiTi.xyz

instruction: Implement modeling of Cu twinning using LAMMPS.
output:
units metal
boundary p p p
atom_style atomic
timestep 0.001
neighbor 2.0 bin
neigh_modify delay 0 every 5 check yes
# Create box
lattice fcc 3.61 orient x 1 1 -2 orient y 1 1 1 orient z 1 -1 0  
region box block 0 10 0 10 0 10
create_box 2 box
# Create upper Cu
lattice fcc 3.61 origin 0.6 0.5 0  orient x 1 1 -2 orient y 1 1 1 orient z 1 -1 0 
region upper block 0 10 0 5 0 10
create_atoms 1 region upper
group upper region upper
# Create lower Cu
lattice fcc 3.61  origin 0 0.2 0 orient x -1 -1 2 orient y 1 1 1 orient z -1 1 0
region lower block 0 10 5 10 0 10
create_atoms 2 region lower
group lower region lower
# Set molar masses
mass 1 63.55
mass 2 63.55
# Save model
write_data Cu.data

instruction: Implement modeling of NiTi alloy using LAMMPS and divide into three working areas.
input:
Method:
(1)Divide into three regions.
(2)Use the create_atoms command to fill different types of atoms in these three regions, respectively.
output:
units metal
atom_style atomic
# NiTi modeling
lattice custom 3.01 a1 1 0 0 a2 0 1 0 a3 0 0 1 &
basis 0 0 0 &
basis 0.5 0.5 0.5
region box block 0 30 0 3 0 20
create_box 6 box
# Layering
region fixed_layer block INF INF INF INF INF 4
region temp_layer block INF INF INF INF 4 16
region newton_layer block INF INF INF INF 16 INF
# Fill atoms in the three layers
create_atoms 1 region fixed_layer basis 1 2 basis 2 1
create_atoms 1 region temp_layer basis 1 4 basis 2 3
create_atoms 1 region newton_layer basis 1 6 basis 2 5
mass 1 58.693 # Ni
mass 2 47.867 # Ti
mass 3 58.693 # Ni
mass 4 47.867 # Ti
mass 5 58.693 # Ni
mass 6 47.867 # Ti
write_data NiTi.xyz

instruction: Implement modeling of a water sphere model using LAMMPS.
output:
units real
atom_style full
# Create box
region box block -20 20 -20 20 -20 20 units box
# Number of atoms, bonds, angles, etc., inside the box
create_box 2 box bond/types 1 angle/types 1 extra/bond/per/atom 2 &
extra/special/per/atom 2 extra/angle/per/atom 1
# Lattice for H2O, adjustable lattice dimensions to control the number of water molecules or water density
lattice bcc 3.92
# Define the region
region H2O sphere 0 0 0 18 units box
# Set the molecular template id to water, corresponding to the file water.data
molecule water water.data
# Fill the spherical region with water molecules
create_atoms 0 region H2O mol water 3453 units box
# Set atomic molar masses
mass 1 16
mass 2 1
# Save the model file
write_data H2O.data

instruction: Implement modeling of graphene desalinating seawater using LAMMPS.
output:
# Model basic parameters
units real
atom_style full
boundary p p p
# Custom graphene lattice
lattice custom 2.4768 a1 1.3727 0.0 0.0 a2 0.0 1 0.0 a3 0.0 0.0 1.732 &
basis 0.0 0.0 0.33333 &
basis 0.0 0.0 0.66667 &
basis 0.0 0.5 0.16667 &
basis 0.0 0.5 0.83333
# Define box dimensions
region box block 0 45 0 25 0 20
# Create box
create_box 5 box bond/types 1 angle/types 1 extra/bond/per/atom 2 &
extra/angle/per/atom 1 extra/special/per/atom 2
# Fill graphene atoms
region graphene block 90 100 INF INF INF INF units box
create_atoms 5 region graphene
# Create seawater region
region water_region block 2 88 INF INF INF INF units box
# Define TIP4P water molecule
molecule water TIP4P.txt
# Fill water molecules, number of water molecules is 8000
create_atoms 0 random 8000 9090 water_region mol water 9567 units box
# Randomly fill Na atoms, number 800
create_atoms 3 random 800 8989 water_region
# Set Na charge, Na atom becomes Na+
set type 3 charge 1.0
# Randomly fill Cl atoms, number 800
create_atoms 4 random 800 8900 water_region
# Set Cl charge, Cl->Cl-
set type 4 charge -1.0
# Set molar masses
mass 1 15.9994
mass 2 1.008
mass 3 28.990
mass 4 35.453
mass 5 12
# Save trajectory file
write_data all.data

instruction: Implement modeling of amorphous SiO2 using LAMMPS.
input: The sio2.data model file is considered known.
output:
units metal
atom_style atomic
boundary p p p
timestep 0.001
neighbor 2 bin
neigh_modify every 1 delay 0 check yes
# Read data file
read_data sio2.data
# Potential function settings
pair_style tersoff
pair_coeff * * SiO.tersoff O Si
# Temperature initialization
velocity all create 7000 98989
# High-temperature relaxation
dump 1 all atom 1000 dump.xyz
fix 1 all npt temp 7000 7000 0.1 iso 100 100 1
run 50000
unfix 1
# Cooling
fix 1 all npt temp 7000 300 0.1 iso 1 1 1
run 50000
unfix 1
# 300K relaxation
fix 1 all nvt temp 300 300 0.1
run 50000
# Save amorphous file
write_data sio2_a.data

instruction: Use LAMMPS for modeling, with the upper part being Si, the lower part being Cu, and a mixed Si/Cu region at the interface, reserving a crack in the mixed region.
output:
units metal
boundary p p p
atom_style atomic
timestep 0.001
neighbor 2 bin
neigh_modify every 1 delay 0 check yes
# Box
region box block 0 100 0 20 0 60 units box
create_box 2 box
# Bottom Cu modeling
lattice fcc 3.61
region cu block INF INF INF INF INF 25 units box
create_atoms 1 region cu
# Top Si modeling
lattice diamond 5.43
region si block INF INF INF INF 25 INF units box 
create_atoms 2 region si
# Middle region modeling
region middle block INF INF INF INF 25 35 units box
create_atoms 1 random 1500 9899 middle
create_atoms 2 random 1500 68678 middle
# Crack
region crack block 35 65 INF INF 28 32 units box
delete_atoms region crack
mass 1 64
mass 2 28
# Potential function settings
pair_style hybrid eam/fs tersoff lj/cut 10
pair_coeff * * eam/fs Cu1.eam.fs Cu NULL
pair_coeff * * tersoff SiC.tersoff NULL Si
pair_coeff 1 2 lj/cut 0.0846  2.99
# Save model
write_data all.data

basis 0.0 0.0 0.0 &

create_atoms 1 box
mass 1 24

instruction: Rotate GaN along the x-axis by 90 degrees using LAMMPS.
input: The GaN.data model file is considered known.
output:
units metal
atom_style atomic
boundary s s s
read_data GaN.data
# Calculate the center of mass
variable x0 equal xcm(all,x)
variable y0 equal xcm(all,y)
variable z0 equal xcm(all,z)
# Rotate by 90 degrees
displace_atoms all rotate ${x0} ${y0} ${z0} 1 0 0 90
# Save the new model
write_data new.data

# Model parameters
units real
atom_style full
bond_style harmonic
angle_style harmonic
pair_style lj/cut/tip4p/long 1 2 1 1 0.1546 12.0
kspace_style pppm/tip4p 1.0e-4
# Modeling
lattice fcc 4.04
region box block -15 15 -4 4 -9 9
create_box 5 box &
           bond/types 1 &
           angle/types 1 &
           extra/bond/per/atom 2 &
           extra/angle/per/atom 1 &
           extra/special/per/atom 2
# Set top and bottom walls
region rbotwall block -15 15 -4 4 -8 -6
region rtopwall block -15 15 -4 4 6 8
region rwall union 2 rbotwall rtopwall
create_atoms 5 region rwall
# Add water molecules in a lattice manner
region rliquid block -15 15 -4 4 -5 5
molecule h2omol TIP4P2005.txt
lattice sc 4.04
create_atoms 0 region rliquid mol h2omol 482793
# Randomly add Na+ and Cl- ions
fix mydep1 all deposit 20 3 1 56513 region rliquid near 0.3
fix mydep2 all deposit 20 4 1 58613 region rliquid near 0.3
# Molar masses
mass 1 16 # O
mass 2 1 # H
mass 3 23 # Na+
mass 4 35 # Cl-
mass 5 27 # Al
# Force field parameter settings
pair_coeff 1 1 0.185199 3.1589 # O
pair_coeff 2 2 0.0 0.0 # H
pair_coeff 3 3 0.04690 2.4299 # Na+
pair_coeff 4 4 0.1500 4.04470 # Cl-
pair_coeff 5 5 11.697 2.574 # Al
bond_coeff 1 0 0.9572 # O-H
angle_coeff 1 0 104.52 # H-O-H
# Charges
set type 3 charge 1.0
set type 4 charge -1.0
# Run for 20 steps
run 20
# Save data file
write_data system.data

instruction: Implement modeling of randomly inserting graphene sheets into a Cu-based body using LAMMPS.
input: The cu.data and gp.data two model files are considered known.
output:
atom_style atomic
boundary p p p
units metal
# Generate three random numbers
variable dx1 equal floor(random(1,20,5989))
variable dy1 equal floor(random(1,20,456))
variable dz1 equal floor(random(1,20,289))
variable dx equal ${dx1}
variable dy equal ${dy1}
variable dz equal ${dz1}
read_data cu.data extra/atom/types 1
# Use the shift command to randomly adjust the position of graphene
read_data gp.data add append offset 1 0 0 0 0 shift ${dx} ${dy} ${dz} 
pair_style hybrid lj/cut 10 eam/fs airebo 3.0
pair_coeff * * eam/fs Cu1.eam.fs Cu NULL
pair_coeff * * airebo CH.airebo NULL C
pair_coeff 1 2 lj/cut 0.01996 3.225
group cu type 1
group gp type 2
# Delete overlapping atoms
delete_atoms overlap 2 cu gp
write_data cugp.data

instruction: Implement modeling of an acute-angled cutting tool using LAMMPS.
input: Set three regions, use the intersection command to merge them into a closed area, and then generate atoms in this area.
output:

atom_style          atomic
dimension           3
boundary            p p p
timestep            0.001
neighbor            0.2 bin

region box block -50 50 -10 10 -20 50 units box
create_box 1 box
region b block 0 30 -10 10 0 40 units box
variable x1 equal cos(PI*15/180)
variable z1 equal -sin(PI*15/180)

variable x2 equal -sin(PI*15/180)

region tool intersect 3 b p1 p2

create_atoms  1 region tool units box                                                                     
mass 1 12
write_data all.data

instruction: Implement modeling of a hexagonal structure using LAMMPS.
input: Use the region plane to set six faces, use these six faces to form a closed area, and generate atoms within the closed area.
output:
atom_style atomic
units metal
boundary p p p
# Outer circle radius
variable R equal 50
# Create the box
lattice fcc 3.61
region box block -20 20 -20 20 -40 40 
create_box 1 box
# Inclined plane 1
variable x1 equal cos(PI*30/180)
variable y1 equal sin(PI*30/180)  
region p1 plane $R 0 0 ${x1} ${y1} 0  side out units box
# Inclined plane 2
variable x1 equal cos(PI*30/180)
variable y1 equal -sin(PI*30/180)  
region p2 plane -$R 0 0 ${x1} ${y1} 0  side in units box
# Inclined plane 3
variable x1 equal -cos(PI*30/180)
variable y1 equal -sin(PI*30/180)  
region p3 plane -$R 0 0 ${x1} ${y1} 0  side out units box
# Inclined plane 4
variable x1 equal -cos(PI*30/180)
variable y1 equal sin(PI*30/180)  
region p4 plane $R 0 0 ${x1} ${y1} 0  side in units box
# Plane 1
variable y2 equal $R*cos(PI*30/180)
region p5 plane  0 ${y2} 0 0 -1 0  side in units box
# Plane 2
variable y3 equal -$R*cos(PI*30/180)
region p6 plane  0 ${y3} 0 0 1 0  side in units box
# Combine the 6 planes
region piece intersect 6 p1 p2 p3 p4 p5 p6
create_atoms 1 region piece
mass 1 64
write_data all.data
